title: Gudi Padwa
subtitle: Maharashtra’s New Year of Prosperity and Joy
overview: Gudi Padwa marks the traditional New Year for Maharashtrians, symbolizing victory, joy, and renewal.
The festival is celebrated by hoisting the ‘Gudi’ — a bright flag with a pot atop — signifying success and happiness.

highlights.title: Gudi Hoisting
highlights.description: Families hoist Gudi outside homes to welcome prosperity.

highlights.title: Festive Delicacies
highlights.description: Enjoy dishes like Puran Poli and Shrikhand.

geography.intro: Gudi Padwa is celebrated across Maharashtra — prominently in Mumbai, Pune, and Nashik.

climate.description: Pleasant weather with warm days and cool evenings.

geography.conclusion: Gudi Padwa ushers in positivity, good luck, and fresh beginnings.

activities.title: Gudi Hoisting Ceremony
activities.description: Decorate and hoist the traditional Gudi at your home.
info: Use neem leaves, garland, and kalash.

activities.title: Traditional Cooking
activities.description: Prepare and enjoy festive dishes with family.

attractions.title: Cultural Processions
attractions.description: Pune and Mumbai host colorful street parades.

attractions.title: Decorated Streets
attractions.description: Women in traditional sarees and men in pagdis celebrate joyously.

marineLife.intro: Gudi Padwa is a land-based festival celebrating nature’s renewal.

items.title: Spring Symbolism
items.description: Represents the start of the harvest season.

conclusion: A festival of joy, culture, and vibrant beginnings.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Mumbai, Pune, and Nagpur have major airports.

bookingTips.description: Plan ahead as it coincides with other festivals.
